DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure No Head and Neck Lymphadenectomy Performed Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the specified reason a head and neck lymph node surgical procedure was not performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure No Head and Neck Lymphadenectomy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means in which lymph nodes of the head and neck are removed and examined to see whether they contain cancer was not performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: No Head and Neck Lymphadenectomy Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966):Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify a reason or event that caused a patient to be removed from a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
